newsitem.title: USA: Montgomery Ward undecided on store closings.
newsitem.headline: Montgomery Ward undecided on store closings.

text.p: Montgomery Ward & Co Inc, which filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection Monday, said Tuesday it has not decided whether to close any of its 408 stores or cut jobs as part of its reorganization.

"Chapter 11 gives Montgomery Ward the opportunity to reorganize and restructure," said Montgomery Ward Chairman and Chief Executive Roger Goddu in a statement. "At the moment, we have made no decision on additional store closings or layoffs."

The 125-year-old store chain filed for bankruptcy in Wilmington, Del., after talks with lenders on a financial package to rescue the company failed. Montgomery Ward is 50-percent owned by General Electric Co's General Electric Capital Corp.

"During this time, it will be business as usual in our stores as we continue to implement the core strategy that was widely accepted by our financial partners," Goddu said. "Our employee payroll will continue wihtout interruption, and the normal benefits and pension fund are intact and protected."
